title: Missions in Co-op vs AI
body: I went into a Co-op vs AI game today because I wanted to practice a champion, and found that people were cheezing out against the AI to complete missions. Opinion: missions should not be enabled in this gamemode? Possibly the one exception for this would be the 'play as [champion]' missions, as it's pretty harsh to play a new champ in pvp.

replies.body:
The purpose of making missions achievable in bots is so that all types of players can take part in the events. 
Players who have bad internet and would be putting their team at a disadvantage, new players that aren't confident to play PVP yet, people that simply don't want to play PVP.

There isn't really a bad side for letting players get their missions done in bots.

Let's not forget the mission for your team to get 1,200 cs in a game. Practically impossible in a Ranked game unless it goes for over an hour, in which case you've basically lost your early item advantage.
Not to mention, people who might not have time to try and achieve missions in PvP, where many of them would be a great deal harder.
Theres nothing wrong using bots to finish missions?
